I remember, clang had some warnings (fixed in 8579cd32e3ee) because [virtual void Base::Update()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/2b9f6a3073f309d0242137ea7c17826f4e73a05f/gazebo/physics/Base.hh#Base.hh-173) had a different signature than [void Link::Update(const common::UpdateInfo &_info)](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/2b9f6a3073f309d0242137ea7c17826f4e73a05f/gazebo/physics/Link.hh#Link.hh-98). The `using Base::Update` allows `Link` to call either `Update` function, depending on the arguments.

So if they have the same signature, `using` shouldn't be needed.
content.html:
I remember, clang had some warnings (fixed in 8579cd32e3ee) because virtual void Base::Update() had a different signature than void Link::Update(const common::UpdateInfo &_info). The using Base::Update allows Link to call either Update function, depending on the arguments.

So if they have the same signature, using shouldn't be needed.
